pli-tv-bu-vb-sk18:0.5: 18. The second training rule on swinging the arms
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk18:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk18:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were swinging and dangling their arms while sitting in inhabited areas. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk18:1.3.1: “‘I will not swing my arms while sitting in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk18:1.4: One should not swing one’s arms while sitting in an inhabited area;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk18:1.5: one should sit keeping one’s arms steady.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk18:1.6: If a monk, out of disrespect, swings and dangles his arms while sitting in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk18:1.12: if he has entered his dwelling;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk18:1.15: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk18:1.16: The eighth training rule is finished.
